No worries, I'm here to help

patterns: What are the functions of AICTE?
responses:
All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) was set up in November 1945 as a national-level Apex Advisory Body to conduct a survey on the facilities available for technical education and to promote development in the country in a coordinated and integrated manner.
For more information visit :  https://www.aicte-india.org/

patterns: Can I contact about queries through mail?
How can I contact through mail regarding queries?
Where Can I mail queries related to portal and approval related issues for the approval process 2021-22?
responses: No queries through email will be entertained

Undergraduate Degree Courses in Engineering & Technology (Vol. I)
Undergraduate Degree Courses in Engineering & Technology (Vol. II)
Postgraduate Degree Courses in Engineering & Technology (Vol. I)
Postgraduate Degree Courses in Engineering & Technology (Vol. II)
Management Program (MBA & PGDM)

patterns: What are the List of Bureaus of AICTE
responses:
The AICTE comprises following bureaus, namely:

e-Governance (e-Gov) Bureau
Approval (AB) Bureau
Planning and Co-ordination (PC) Bureau and Academic (Acad) Bureau
University (UB) Bureau
Administration (Admin) Bureau
Finance (Fin) Bureau
Research, Institutional and Faculty Development (RIFD) Bureau
Apart from this there are 10 Board of Studies dealing with technician, vocational, undergraduate engineering, postgraduate engineering and research, architecture, town and country planning, pharmacy, management, applied arts and crafts, hotel management and catering technology education.

patterns: What is the All India Council for Technical Skill Development?
What do you mean by AICTSD?
responses: All India Council for Technical Skill Development for AICTSD is a National non-profitable organization which was set up with an objective to improve the technical skills of youth in the country.

patterns: What are various schemes and intiatives of AICTE?
Can I know schemes and initiatives under AICTE?
Does AICTE have any schemes and initiatives?
responses:
Multiple schemes and programmes have been initiated by the All India Council For Technical Education (AICTE) for the development of education in the country. Discussed below are the same in brief:

Student Development Schemes
Pragati Scheme to award meritorious girls
Saksham Scholarship for Different Abled students
Prerna Scheme for SC/ST Students preparing for higher education
Smariddhi Scheme for SC/ST students to help them with their startups
Faculty Development Schemes
National Initiative for Technical Teachers Training (NITTT)
Distinguished Visiting Professorship Scheme
Institutional Development Schemes
AICTE-IDEA (Idea Development, Evaluation & Application) Lab
AICTE Scheme for promoting Interest, Creativity and Ethics among Students
E- SHODH SINDHU for free access to e-Journals/ e-Resources to AICTE approved Government/ Government-Aided technical institutes
Research & Innovation Development schemes
Entrepreneurship Development Cell
Collaborative Research Scheme (CRS) to provide research grant to young faculty members
General Schemes
Saansad Aadarsh Gram Yojana for rural development

patterns: Who is the current Chairman of All India Council For Technical Education?
responses: As in January 2021, Anil Dattatraya Sahasrabudhe is the Chairman of All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE). He is also working as Professor of Mechanical Engineering at Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Guwahati.

patterns: What is the All India Council For Technical Education Act 1987?
responses: AICTE Act was published by the Ministry of Law & Justice for the development of AICTE with an aim to provide proper planning and coordinated development of the technical education system in India.
